quote: The most common personal tasks I use AI for are really just summarizing information from the web. I'm using Perplexity as a kind of default search engine to skip straight to the synthesis.
It does most of the job that Google's Gemini-based AI summaries do at the top of search results, but I find it to be a little bit more robust and thorough.
I also use AI quite a lot for summarizing long documents and similar tasks.
I use it a lot when writing code.
Sometimes there are limits on the tiers of AI tools that I'm using, and sometimes it just doesn't do a good job.
It's interesting with AI because a little bit of wrong is sometimes just the straw that makes it all not useful.

I think I was mostly comfortable with the experience, but it needs a lot of lead-in. I need to be able to trust where my information is going and how it's being processed before I start interacting with the LLM.
Yeah, it's that lack of upfront clarity and trust-building that makes it problematic more than anything else.
